newsitem.title: USA: LCRA sees 430 MW Texas gas plant on line Tuesday.
newsitem.headline: LCRA sees 430 MW Texas gas plant on line Tuesday.

text.p: Lower Colorado River Authority (LCRA) said Monday its 430 megawatt (MW) natural gas-fired Ferguson generating plant was expected to return on line late Tuesday after being shut last Thursday.
The station in Marble Falls, Texas, was taken off line after a superheater tube ruptured, said spokesman Bill McCann. "They hope to have the plant back late tomorrow," he added.
LCRA shut a 600 MW coal-fired unit at its Fayette Power Project in La Grange, Texas, this past weekend for seasonal maintenance. The unit was scheduled to startup by early December.
Based in Austin, LCRA is a wholesale supplier of water and electricity.
